session.goal: Implement Financial Dashboard with Plaid bank sync and AI spending analysis

changes.summary: Complete Financial Dashboard — Plaid bank sync, AI spending analysis, subscription tracking, 38 tests, pushed to sandbox
decisions_made: Followed StaffingDashboard architecture pattern for consistency
Used react-plaid-link for Plaid Link integration
Rule-based categorization with Gemini AI fallback for transaction categorization
Removed plaid_item_id from financialAccountSchema indexes (DXE1 Dexie adapter requirement)
Removed ignoreDuplicate:true from createRxDatabase (DB9 in RxDB v16 non-dev mode)
Subscription detection via merchant grouping + recurring charge pattern matching
19-category transaction taxonomy covering business and personal spending

next_immediate_step.details: PR #4 (sandbox → main) includes financial dashboard. User reviews and merges.

next_three_steps: Set up Plaid sandbox credentials as Supabase secrets
Deploy Supabase Edge Functions (supabase functions deploy)
Run supabase/schema.sql to create financial tables
continuation.context_notes: Feature is code-complete. Plaid integration requires sandbox credentials for end-to-end testing.
